candidates.title: Pin tokio version to ~1.14
candidates.body:
### Description

The `tokio` project recently changed their MSRV to `1.49.0`. This PR will pin the `tokio` dependency version to `~1.14` which is prior to their MSRV increase.

### Notes to the reviewers

The LDK team took this approach for their `tokio` dev-dependency, see https://github.com/lightningdevkit/rust-lightning/pull/1315. 

As long as `tokio` backports bug fixes  to`1.14.x` releases this should be safe. If we need any new features we can revisit this decision.

### Checklists

#### All Submissions:

* [x] I've signed all my commits
* [x] I followed the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] I ran `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy` before committing

#### New Features:

* [ ] I've updated `CHANGELOG.md`

candidates.title: Use rust-bip39 instead of tiny-bip39
candidates.body:
<!-- You can erase any parts of this template not applicable to your Pull Request. -->

### Description

Fixes #399. This can solve the current version conflict issues of `tiny-bip39` dependencies and replace that with `rust-bip39`. 

Few small refactoring changes were required for that.

`rust-bip39` doesn't have dedicated `MnemonicType` enum to denote mnemonic entropy (aka word count). To make the impl consistent with existing traits I have wrote a simple `WordCount` enum to capture that.   

### Notes to the reviewers

All previous tests are passing.

### Checklists

#### All Submissions:

* [x] I've signed all my commits
* [x] I followed the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] I ran `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy` before committing

candidates.title: Pin ahash version to 0.7.4 for sqlite feature
candidates.body:
### Description

The `ahash` crate is used by the `sqlite` feature but the latest update (0.7.5)
breaks compatibility with our current MSRV 1.46.0. See also:
https://github.com/tkaitchuck/aHash/issues/99

### Notes to the reviewers

To reproduce the issue locally before applying this patch:
```shell
cargo update
cargo +1.46.0 build --features sqlite
```

### Checklists

#### All Submissions:

* [x] I've signed all my commits
* [x] I followed the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] I ran `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy` before committing

candidates.title: Downgrade tiny-bip39 to version prior to 0.8.0
candidates.body:
### Description

This is required until BDK MSRV is changed to 1.51 or we replace the `tiny-bip39` dependency (see #399).

### Notes to the reviewers

We were able to fix this issue with `zeroize_derive` by downgrading it to version `1.1.0` but that version was [yanked from crates.io](https://crates.io/crates/zeroize_derive/versions) two days ago. So now I'm downgrading `tiny-bip39` to a version prior to 0.8.

### Checklists

candidates.title: [fix-build] Fix version of zeroize_derive < 1.2.0
candidates.body:
zeroize_derive minor version bump 1.2 introduced a breaking change somehow. Fix it below until we figure out what to do! We already fix `zeroize` so this should not be a big deal.

update: For some reason I have to fix it exactly with `~1.1.0` for it to work otherwise cargo decides to use `1.0.0` which we can't have!

candidates.title: Update dev-dependencies electrsd to 0.10 and required additional crates
candidates.body:
### Description

Fix CI by upgrading dev-dependencies electrsd to ^0.10.  See required PRs https://github.com/RCasatta/bitcoind/pull/18 and https://github.com/RCasatta/electrsd/pull/15.

### Notes to the reviewers

The new electrsd will use `OUT_DIR` instead of `CARGO_HOME` to store bitcoind and electrsd executables. To be able to use `electrs` ^0.10 I also had to change dependencies bitcoincore-rpc to core-rpc, update bitcoin to ^0.27 and miniscript to ^6.0.

candidates.title: [test] add tests to verify support for sending to bech32m address
candidates.body:
### Description

This PR is in reference to #396 
It adds some tests to confirm sending transactions to Bech32m addresses, introduced in [BIP350](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0350.mediawiki)

**Note:** This change requires `bitcoin-core` `v22.0` to be incorporated into bitcoind.

candidates.title: implement sqlite database
candidates.body:
### Description

This PR implements all the Database related traits for a database backed by sqlite.  It currently uses cached prepared statements which simplify the implementation from trying to use actual prepared Statement objects owned by the SqliteDatabase struct.  It should have the same performance as long as the cache is large enough to hold all the statements.

In my own project I use a crate called rusqlite_migration to handle migrations but in an attempt to reduce dependencies I borrowed a simple migration implementation by jb55 that manages a version based on the length of the static migrations array.

### Notes to the reviewers

<!-- In this section you can include notes directed to the reviewers, like explaining why some parts
of the PR were done in a specific way -->

### Checklists

candidates.title: Parallel blockchain tests
candidates.body:
### Description

Our Blockchain tests must be executed serially because we start only 1 backend node and interleaving test could lead to wrong results.
This PR adds dev-dependencies `bitcoind` and `electrsd` making it easier to start/stop bitcoind and electrs independent processes for each test.
This allows to launch tests in parallel and make it easier to launch single test (providing an env var to bitcoind/electrs executables).

Even if launching multiple nodes it's more costly, parallel execution leads to improve test execution time:
test-electrum before:
`test result: ok. 17 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 194 filtered out; finished in 83.41s`
test-electrum after:
`test result: ok. 17 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 194 filtered out; finished in 25.41s`

Other than the parallelism performance are improved because electrsd support signalling to electrs to start indexing.

### Notes to the reviewers

I removed docker entirely, downloading needed executables. The other options was to keep docker as an executable provider, but I preferred the former.
UPDATE: bitcoind crate now automatically download the needed binary if the feature is specified, I plan to do the same for electrs. ~~After that we could decide to remove feature "test-*" since there will be no pre-requirements (`cargo test --features rpc` will run rpc tests)~~ Removing "test-*" would have required having some dep moved to non-dev dependencies so I avoided that. But now test-blockchains is activated whenever "test-*" is enabled

For bitcoind binary releases make it easier to download the binaries, while unfortunately electrs doesn't ship binaries (and we need also the outdated esplora version) so I did the build through [github action](https://github.com/RCasatta/electrsd/actions/workflows/build_electrs.yml) and hosted that on github electrsd repository. 

### Checklists

#### All Submissions:

* [x] I've signed all my commits
* [x] I followed the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] I ran `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy` before committing

candidates.title: Add a ureq version of esplora module
candidates.body:
### Description

The `Blockchain` implementation for connecting to an Esplora instance is currently based on `reqwest`. Some users may not wish to use reqwest.

`ureq` is a simple HTTP client (no async) that is useful when `reqwest` is not suitable.

- Move `esplora.rs` -> `esplora/reqwest.rs`
- Add an implementation based on the `reqwest` esplora code but using `ureq`
- Add feature flags and conditional includes to re-export everything to the `esplora` module so we don't effect the rest of the code base.

This allows us to also remove the forced dependency on `tokio`.

Add comments to the manifest in an attempt to make it clear which features are needed under which circumstances.

### CI changes

This PR adds feature builds for esplora/ureq, async-interface, and in the WASM section adds reqwest as required. Please review carefully.

### Checklists

#### All Submissions:

* [x] I've signed all my commits
* [x] I followed the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoindevkit/bdk/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] I ran `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy` before committing

#### New Features:

* [x] I've added tests for the new feature
* [x] I've added docs for the new feature
* [x] I've updated `CHANGELOG.md`
